get.summary: Find the activities in the Marketing Automation system, using the given, optional CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities whose type contains the word 'email', the search expression parameter will be where=type like '%email%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned. If there are no matches to search expression empty results are returned.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for activities created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all activities are returned in a paginated fashion.
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields

get.summary:
Find leads in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all leads whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for visitors created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all visitors are returned in a paginated fashion.

created_at.description: Time that visitor activity occurred; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone.

details.description: Details about this visitor activity such as the name of the object associated with this activity, the search phrase used in a site search query, etc.

email_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

email_template_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

file_id.description: Pardot ID of the file associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a file associated with it

form_handler_id.description: Pardot ID of the form handler associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form handler associated with it

form_id.description: Pardot ID of the form associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form associated with it

id.description: Pardot ID for this visitor activity.

landing_page_id.description: Pardot ID of the landing page associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a landing page associated with it

list_email_id.description: Pardot ID of the list email associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

multivariate_test_variation_id.description: Pardot ID of the multivariate test variation associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a multivariate test variation associated with it

paid_search_id_id.description: Pardot ID of the paid search ad associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a paid search ad associated with it

prospect_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated prospect.

site_search_query_id.description: Pardot ID of the site search query associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a site search query associated with it

visitor_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated visitor.

visitor_page_view_id.description: Pardot ID of the visitor page view associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a visitor page view associated with it

ContactPost.description: A contact object. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated are those required to create a new contact. For other contact operations, the required fields will be a subset of these fields. There will be other fields returned with a Contact, which are not all described here.

crm_account_fid.description: Account ID in a supported CRM system

crm_contact_fid.description: Prospect's contact ID in a supported CRM system

crm_last_sync.description: Last time this prospect was synced with a supported CRM system

crm_lead_fid.description: Prospect's lead ID in a supported CRM system

crm_owner_fid.description: Prospect's owner ID in a supported CRM system

crm_url.description: URL to view the prospect within the CRM system

is_do_not_call.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be called

is_do_not_email.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be emailed

is_reviewed.description: If value is 1, prospect has been reviewed

is_starred.description: If value is 1, prospect has been starred

opted_out.description: If value is 1, prospect has opted out of marketing communications

recent_interaction.description: Describes the prospect's most recent interaction with Pardot

years_in_business.description: Prospect's number of years in business
